objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Operation Dream Job / Gemini Recon
objects.description: Lazarus Group (tracked as UNC2970) is using Google's Gemini AI to synthesize OSINT, profile high-value targets in the defense sector, and craft highly tailored phishing personas.

objects.content:
Sector: Defense, Aerospace, Cybersecurity

Modus operandi:
Use of LLMs for target research, salary mapping, and technical role profiling to improve social engineering success.

objects.name: Energy & Healthcare Extortion
objects.description: The Qilin ransomware gang has targeted the Romanian national oil pipeline operator Conpet and the US healthcare firm ApolloMD, exfiltrating massive amounts of sensitive data.

objects.content:
Sector: Energy, Healthcare

Modus operandi:
Double extortion involving data theft (up to 1TB in some cases) and public leaking on dark web sites.

objects.name: CVE-2026-20700
objects.description:
A memory corruption vulnerability in the Dynamic Link Editor (dyld) that allows for arbitrary code execution. It is the first Apple zero-day confirmed as exploited in 2026.

Affected product: iOS, macOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS, visionOS

Affected vendor: Apple

CPE: cpe:2.3:o:apple:iphone_os:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*
labels: iOS, macOS, iPadOS, tvOS, watchOS, visionOS

objects.name: CVE-2026-1731
objects.description:
A critical pre-authentication remote code execution vulnerability triggered through specially crafted client requests. Active exploitation has been reported following PoC publication.

Affected product: Remote Support, Privileged Remote Access

Affected vendor: BeyondTrust

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:beyondtrust:remote_support:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-21643
objects.description:
SQL Injection vulnerability in the web interface allowing unauthenticated remote code execution.

Affected product: FortiClientEMS

Affected vendor: Fortinet

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:fortinet:forticlient_ems:7.4.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-1357
objects.description:
Critical RCE flaw due to improper RSA decryption handling and lack of path sanitization, allowing arbitrary file uploads.

Affected product: WPvivid Backup & Migration plugin

Affected vendor: WPVividPlugins

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:wpvivid:wpvivid_backup_migration:*:*:*:*:*:wordpress:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Odido
objects.description:
Major Dutch telecom provider Odido suffered a breach impacting 6.2 million customers. Stolen data includes names, addresses, phone numbers, IBANs, and ID document numbers.

Sector: Telecommunications

objects.content:
Sector: Telecommunications

Theme: Information Control & Censorship

The Russian government has intensified its crackdown on non-controlled communication platforms, attempting to block WhatsApp and Telegram by excluding their domains from the National DNS system to encourage the use of the state-controlled 'MAX' messenger.

Tags: Russia, Censorship, Roskomnadzor

objects.name: SSHStalker Linux Botnet
objects.description:
A new botnet targeting Linux servers using a mix of legacy IRC-based C2 and modern Go-based mass-compromise automation.

Analysis:
SSHStalker demonstrates the effectiveness of 'old-school' tactics combined with modern scanning. It optimizes for scale, installing multiple backdoors once access is gained via brute-forced SSH passwords.

Recommendations:
- Implement strong SSH password policies and enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
- Monitor for unusual IRC traffic and cron job modifications on Linux systems.

objects.name: CVE-2026-25253
objects.description: Vulnerability CVE-2026-25253 referenced in threat report.

objects.name: OpenClaw AI Agent Risks
objects.description:
Malicious 'skills' in the ClawHub ecosystem for OpenClaw are delivering stealers like Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS). A 1-click RCE vulnerability (CVE-2026-25253) was also identified.

Analysis:
OpenClaw's rapid adoption has outpaced its security governance. The 'ClawHavoc' campaign uses typosquatted or poisoned plugins to compromise AI agent environments.

Recommendations:
- Restrict AI agent access to local network only (127.0.0.1) and avoid installing third-party skills from unverified sources.

objects.content: The threat landscape for February 2026 is defined by two major trends: the fragmentation of criminal ecosystems and the rapid 'agentization' of Artificial Intelligence. Recorded Future reports that while law enforcement has disrupted large ransomware syndicates, they have reconstituted into smaller, modular, and more resilient cells. Concurrently, the rise of AI-powered autonomous agents like OpenClaw introduces a new attack surface, where malicious 'skills' and prompt injections allow for rapid exploitation. Significant patching activity from Apple (first exploited zero-day of the year), Microsoft (6 exploited flaws), and Fortinet underscores a high-pressure environment for administrators.
